name: A. We Need the Zero
statement:
There is an array a consisting of non-negative integers. You can choose
an integer x and denote b_i=a_i
oplus x for all 1
le i
le n, where
oplus denotes the bitwise XOR operation. Is it possible to choose such a
number x that the value of the expression b_1
oplus b_2
oplus
ldots
oplus b_n equals 0?It can be shown that if a valid number x exists, then
there also exists x such that (0
le x < 2^8).
editorial:
Note that equals if is even, or if is odd. Then, if the length of the
array is odd, you must print of the whole array. And if the length is
even, we canât change the value of the expression with our operation. It
turns out that if of the whole array is , we can output any number, but
otherwise there is no answer.
